intro: Bupleurum densiflorum, commonly known as denseflower skullcap, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and compound leaves with a fern-like appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, and it produces oval, dark brown seeds. Bupleurum densiflorum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments.
